meanings.sent1: The old law was abolishable, so the government decided to get rid of it.
meanings.sent2: The abolishable rule was finally removed after years of debate.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the abolishable tradition disappear overnight.
meanings.sent4: The idea of freedom made the abolishable restrictions seem like chains breaking.
meanings.sent5: The concept of an abolishable monarchy was revolutionary at the time.

meanings.sent1: The abolishable policy was under review by the committee.
meanings.sent2: The abolishable tax was a hot topic in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The abolishable practice seemed like a ticking time bomb waiting to be dismantled.
meanings.sent4: The abolishable law hung over the citizens like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The thought of an abolishable system gave hope to those seeking change.
